trans-unit.source: Creating a Derby database and running SQL statements

seg-source.mrk: Creating a Derby database and running SQL statements

target.mrk: Creating a Derby database and running SQL statements

trans-unit.source: Now, you will use the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> <codeph>ij</codeph> tool to load the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database engine. You will use the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> embedded driver to create and connect to the <codeph>firstdb</codeph> database. You will also use a few basic SQL statements to create and populate a table.

seg-source.mrk: Now, you will use the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> <codeph>ij</codeph> tool to load the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database engine.
You will use the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> embedded driver to create and connect to the <codeph>firstdb</codeph> database.
You will also use a few basic SQL statements to create and populate a table.

target.mrk: Now, you will use the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> <codeph>ij</codeph> tool to load the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> database engine.
You will use the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> embedded driver to create and connect to the <codeph>firstdb</codeph> database.
You will also use a few basic SQL statements to create and populate a table.

trans-unit.source: If you included the <codeph>DERBY_HOME/bin</codeph> directory in your PATH environment variable, type:

seg-source.mrk: If you included the <codeph>DERBY_HOME/bin</codeph> directory in your PATH environment variable, type:

target.mrk: If you included the <codeph>DERBY_HOME/bin</codeph> directory in your PATH environment variable, type:

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, you can use the <codeph>java</codeph> command to start the <codeph>ij</codeph> tool, as shown in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: Otherwise, you can use the <codeph>java</codeph> command to start the <codeph>ij</codeph> tool, as shown in the following table.

target.mrk: Otherwise, you can use the <codeph>java</codeph> command to start the <codeph>ij</codeph> tool, as shown in the following table.

trans-unit.source: This table lists the commands to start the <codeph>ij</codeph> tool on UNIX and Windows systems.

seg-source.mrk: This table lists the commands to start the <codeph>ij</codeph> tool on UNIX and Windows systems.

target.mrk: This table lists the commands to start the <codeph>ij</codeph> tool on UNIX and Windows systems.

trans-unit.source: Create the database and open a connection to the database using the embedded driver.

seg-source.mrk: Create the database and open a connection to the database using the embedded driver.

target.mrk: Create the database and open a connection to the database using the embedded driver.

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>ij</codeph> command to establish a connection to a database. The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> connection URL is enclosed in single quotation marks. An <codeph>ij</codeph> command can be in either uppercase or lowercase.

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>ij</codeph> command to establish a connection to a database.
The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> connection URL is enclosed in single quotation marks.
An <codeph>ij</codeph> command can be in either uppercase or lowercase.

target.mrk: The <codeph>ij</codeph> command to establish a connection to a database.
The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> connection URL is enclosed in single quotation marks.
An <codeph>ij</codeph> command can be in either uppercase or lowercase.

trans-unit.source: The JDBC protocol specification for the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> driver.

seg-source.mrk: The JDBC protocol specification for the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> driver.

target.mrk: The JDBC protocol specification for the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> driver.

trans-unit.source: The name of the database. The name can be any string. Because no filepath is specified, the database is created in the default working directory (<codeph>DERBYTUTOR</codeph>).

seg-source.mrk: The name can be any string.
Because no filepath is specified, the database is created in the default working directory (<codeph>DERBYTUTOR</codeph>).

target.mrk: The name can be any string.
Because no filepath is specified, the database is created in the default working directory (<codeph>DERBYTUTOR</codeph>).

trans-unit.source: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> <varname>URL attribute</varname> that is used to create a database. <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not have an SQL <codeph>create database</codeph> command.

seg-source.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> <varname>URL attribute</varname> that is used to create a database.
<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not have an SQL <codeph>create database</codeph> command.

target.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> <varname>URL attribute</varname> that is used to create a database.
<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not have an SQL <codeph>create database</codeph> command.

trans-unit.source: The semicolon is the <codeph>ij</codeph> command terminator.

seg-source.mrk: The semicolon is the <codeph>ij</codeph> command terminator.

target.mrk: The semicolon is the <codeph>ij</codeph> command terminator.

trans-unit.source: Create a table with two columns using standard SQL.

seg-source.mrk: Create a table with two columns using standard SQL.

target.mrk: Create a table with two columns using standard SQL.

trans-unit.source: CREATE TABLE FIRSTTABLE (ID INT PRIMARY KEY, NAME VARCHAR(12)); 0 rows inserted/updated/deleted

seg-source.mrk: CREATE TABLE FIRSTTABLE (ID INT PRIMARY KEY, NAME VARCHAR(12)); 0 rows inserted/updated/deleted

target.mrk: CREATE TABLE FIRSTTABLE (ID INT PRIMARY KEY, NAME VARCHAR(12)); 0 rows inserted/updated/deleted

trans-unit.source: Perform a simple select of all records in the table.

seg-source.mrk: Perform a simple select of all records in the table.

target.mrk: Perform a simple select of all records in the table.

trans-unit.source: Perform a qualified select of the record with column ID=20.

seg-source.mrk: Perform a qualified select of the record with column ID=20.

target.mrk: Perform a qualified select of the record with column ID=20.

trans-unit.source: SELECT * FROM FIRSTTABLE WHERE ID=20; ID |NAME ------------------------ 20 |TWENTY 1 row selected

seg-source.mrk: SELECT * FROM FIRSTTABLE WHERE ID=20; ID |NAME ------------------------ 20 |TWENTY 1 row selected

target.mrk: SELECT * FROM FIRSTTABLE WHERE ID=20; ID |NAME ------------------------ 20 |TWENTY 1 row selected

trans-unit.source: Optional: Create and populate additional tables and other schema objects.

seg-source.mrk: Optional: Create and populate additional tables and other schema objects.

target.mrk: Optional: Create and populate additional tables and other schema objects.

trans-unit.source: run 'ToursDB_schema.sql'; ij> ... CREATE TABLE AIRLINES ( AIRLINE CHAR(2) NOT NULL , AIRLINE_FULL VARCHAR(24), BASIC_RATE DOUBLE PRECISION, ... 0 rows inserted/updated/deleted ... Other output messages not shown ...

seg-source.mrk: CREATE TABLE AIRLINES ( AIRLINE CHAR(2) NOT NULL , AIRLINE_FULL VARCHAR(24), BASIC_RATE DOUBLE PRECISION, ...

target.mrk: CREATE TABLE AIRLINES ( AIRLINE CHAR(2) NOT NULL , AIRLINE_FULL VARCHAR(24), BASIC_RATE DOUBLE PRECISION, ...

trans-unit.source: Populate the tables with data by running the script <codeph>loadTables.sql</codeph>.

seg-source.mrk: Populate the tables with data by running the script <codeph>loadTables.sql</codeph>.

target.mrk: Populate the tables with data by running the script <codeph>loadTables.sql</codeph>.

trans-unit.source: run 'loadTables.sql'; ij> run 'loadCOUNTRIES.sql'; ij> insert into COUNTRIES values ( 'Afghanistan','AF','Asia'); 1 row inserted/updated/deleted ij> insert into COUNTRIES values ( 'Albania','AL','Europe'); 1 row inserted/updated/deleted ... Other output messages not shown ...

seg-source.mrk: run 'loadTables.sql'; ij> run 'loadCOUNTRIES.sql'; ij> insert into COUNTRIES values ( 'Afghanistan','AF','Asia'); 1 row inserted/updated/deleted ij> insert into COUNTRIES values ( 'Albania','AL','Europe'); 1 row inserted/updated/deleted ...

target.mrk: run 'loadTables.sql'; ij> run 'loadCOUNTRIES.sql'; ij> insert into COUNTRIES values ( 'Afghanistan','AF','Asia'); 1 row inserted/updated/deleted ij> insert into COUNTRIES values ( 'Albania','AL','Europe'); 1 row inserted/updated/deleted ...

trans-unit.source: You should be returned to the <codeph>DERBYTUTOR</codeph> directory.

seg-source.mrk: You should be returned to the <codeph>DERBYTUTOR</codeph> directory.

target.mrk: You should be returned to the <codeph>DERBYTUTOR</codeph> directory.

trans-unit.source: Browse the most important files created by this activity:

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>derby.log</codeph> file. This file is a message and error log that, under normal circumstances, contains a set of startup messages and a shutdown message.

target.mrk: This file is a message and error log that, under normal circumstances, contains a set of startup messages and a shutdown message.

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>firstdb</codeph> database directory. Within the directory are the subdirectories <codeph>seg0</codeph> (containing the data files) and <codeph>log</codeph> (containing the transaction log files).
